adjectives.description: unnarrow (comparative more unnarrow, superlative most unnarrow)

examples: It is modest and unassuming and it celebrates the unnarrow life of a community dedicated to the quest for understanding.

verbs.description: unnarrow (third-person singular simple present unnarrows, present participle unnarrowing, simple past and past participle unnarrowed)

entries.meaning: (rare, transitive) To make less narrow; to broaden or expand.
examples: And if you could see how happy I am you would unnarrow your eyes and be happy for me.
